content.question: ​An X-ray machine is used to eliminate germs in certain food processes. The intensity <math alttext="I"><mi>I</mi></math>, in millirads per hour, of X-rays produced by the machine is inversely proportional to the square of the distance <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math>, in meters, from the machine. For a certain machine, the intensity is <math alttext="26.5"><mn>26.5</mn></math> millirads per hour at a distance of <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> meters. Based on this information and using the same machine, what is the intensity, in millirads per hour, at a distance of <math alttext="3.3"><mn>3.3</mn></math> meters?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
